title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Description (2 points)

· Pores will not form.

· Interleukin release will not be affected/interleukin release continues.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Description (2 points)

· Pores will not form.

· Interleukin release will not be affected/interleukin release continues.

The student response earns one of the following points:

Description (2 points)

· Pores will not form.

· Interleukin release will not be affected/interleukin release continues.

The student response earns two of the following points:

Description (2 points)

· Pores will not form.

· Interleukin release will not be affected/interleukin release continues.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Claim (1 point)

· Removes inhibitor/repressor/inhibitory domain of protein

· Changes the shape/protein structure

Reasoning (1 point)

· Cleaving a precursor/protein/molecule is faster than making one upon infection.

· Cells do not have to wait for transcription and translation/protein synthesis.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Claim (1 point)

· Removes inhibitor/repressor/inhibitory domain of protein

· Changes the shape/protein structure

Reasoning (1 point)

· Cleaving a precursor/protein/molecule is faster than making one upon infection.

· Cells do not have to wait for transcription and translation/protein synthesis.

The student response earns one of the following points:

Claim (1 point)

· Removes inhibitor/repressor/inhibitory domain of protein

· Changes the shape/protein structure

Reasoning (1 point)

· Cleaving a precursor/protein/molecule is faster than making one upon infection.

· Cells do not have to wait for transcription and translation/protein synthesis.

The student response earns two of the following points:

Claim (1 point)

· Removes inhibitor/repressor/inhibitory domain of protein

· Changes the shape/protein structure

Reasoning (1 point)

· Cleaving a precursor/protein/molecule is faster than making one upon infection.

· Cells do not have to wait for transcription and translation/protein synthesis.

title: Part C

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Description (1 point)

· Water enters the cell.
descriptions:

Description (1 point)

The student response earns one of the following points:

Description (1 point)

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Explanation (2 points)

· Cell lysis destroys infected cells OR cell lysis prevents bacteria from replicating.

· Interleukin signaling will stimulate immune cells/components of the immune system (to destroy the infected cells or bacteria).
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

Explanation (2 points)

· Cell lysis destroys infected cells OR cell lysis prevents bacteria from replicating.

· Interleukin signaling will stimulate immune cells/components of the immune system (to destroy the infected cells or bacteria).

The student response earns one of the following points:

Explanation (2 points)

· Cell lysis destroys infected cells OR cell lysis prevents bacteria from replicating.

· Interleukin signaling will stimulate immune cells/components of the immune system (to destroy the infected cells or bacteria).

The student response earns two of the following points:

Explanation (2 points)

· Cell lysis destroys infected cells OR cell lysis prevents bacteria from replicating.

· Interleukin signaling will stimulate immune cells/components of the immune system (to destroy the infected cells or bacteria).
